result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Karen A Frederick

records.addlTxt:
11:03 AM cases 21CF634, 21CF803, 21CF809, 21CM589, 22CM12 called. Defendant Karen A Frederick in court.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Karen A Frederick.  Attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for State of Wisconsin. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Defense recites the joint agreement. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
In 21CF803: Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 2: Disorderly Conduct
In 21CF809: Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 2: Misd Retail Theft
In 21CM589: Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 2: Misd Retail Theft 
Court accepts pleas and finds the Defendant Guilty. Anything else including uncharged case 21CF1451 is dismissed and read in. 
Court withholds sentencing and places defendant on Probation for 1 year with conditions: 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Pay court costs including DNA sample surcharge. 
Provide a DNA sample. 
Pay restitution in the amounts of: 
In 21EC1451: 851.27 plus surcharge payable to Kwik Trip (3 locations)
In 21CF634: 747.37 plus surcharge payable to Hope Gospel joint and several with co defendant. 
In 22CM12: 72.48 plus surcharge payable to Scheels. 
Defendant has two days credit in 21CF809 and 2 day in 21CF803 if revoked. No credit in other files.
Status conference on September 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Cases called at 9:22 AM: 21CF634, 21CF803, 21CF809, 21CM589, 22CM12.  Hearing held via Zoom via Zoom video conferencing and in person.
Defendant Karen A Frederick appeared by video.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Karen A Frederick.  Attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Rivard indicates that an agreement is likely but he did not get the opportunity to speak with the Defendant since she is appearing via video today.
Counsel requests one additional STC before the scheduled trial dates.
STC: 9/16/22 at 11:00 AM (in person)
Jury Trial remains on the calendar for 10/6 and 10/7/22 at 9:00 AM.

3:30 PM cases 21CF634, 21CF803, 21CF809, 21CM589, 22CM12 called. Prosecuting attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Karen A Frederick in court.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Karen A Frederick. Defendant would like new counsel appointed. 
In 21CF634: A jury trial is set to begin in October. 
Defendant expresses her concerns with Attorney Rivard. 
Attorney Rivard responds and expresses concern with continuing as the Defendant's attorney. 
Parties have a colloquy with the court regarding the reasoning for the request. 
Parties would like one more opportunity to resolve. Court will rule at the next hearing if Attorney Rivard is able to withdraw. 
Pretrial is already scheduled for 9-14-22 at 9:15 AM
Final pre-trial on September 14, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Status conference on August 16, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

(Cases 21CF634, 21CF803, 21CF809, 21CM589, 22CM12 are called at 9:18 AM) Defendant Karen A Frederick not in court.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Karen A Frederick. Attorney Matthew Kirkpatrick appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense indicates the Defendant contacted him this morning indicating she was sick, and Defense provided her with the Zoom information. 
Status Conference: 08/16/2022 at 3:30 PM.
Status conference on July 14, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Status conference on September 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

(Cases 21CF634, 21CF803, 21CF809, 21CM589, 22CM12 are called at 2:31 PM - by Zoom) Defendant Karen A Frederick in court.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard appeared by video for Karen A Frederick.  Attorney Robert Stoiber in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense indicates there is no agreement at this time- requests to schedule Jury Trial and Final Status Conference. State requests to set 21CF634 for Jury Trial in ADA Gunderson's absence. Court agrees and indicates the State can file something if they change which case to try first. Discussion held regarding possibility of Motion to Sever from co-defendant. 
Final Status Conference and Jury Trial in 21CF634 to be scheduled with Branch 2 Judicial Assistant. Cases 21CF803, 21CF809, 21CM589, 22CM12 to ride along.
Status conference on May 26, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

2:31 PM Cases called: 21CF634, 21CF803, 21CF809, 21CM589 & 22CM12. Defendant Karen A Frederick not in court.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard appeared by video for Karen A Frederick.  Attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Rivard has been in contact with his client. New date given. STC: 05/26/22 at 2:30pm in person.

(Cases 22CM12, 21CM589, 21CF809, 21CF634, 21CF803 are called at 9:52 AM) Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Karen A Frederick appeared in court, Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard appeared in court for Karen A Frederick. 
Defense acknowledges receipt of Informations in 21CF809, 21CF634, 21CF803, waives reading, enters Not Guilty pleas in21CF809, 21CF634, 21CF803. Court accepts Not Guilty pleas in 21CF809, 21CF634, 21CF803. 
Status Conference already scheduled in all cases: 03/31/2022 at 2:30 PM (Branch 2).
Status conference on March 31, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Karen A Frederick appeared by phone. 
(11:25 AM case called.) All parties and court personnel appear via Zoom.  
Prosecuting attorney Kelly Ronquist appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Karen A Frederick appeared by phone without counsel.
Defendant waives formal reading of the complaint.
Defendant advised of right to an attorney. Defendant updates phone number with the Court.
Court orders the defendant must sign bond in person by 4 pm tomorrow and have finger prints done.
Pre-Trial Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on February 7, 2022 at 1:45 pm.
Hearing scheduled for March 3, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Hearing on March 3, 2022 at 09:30 am.

*Not mailed, defendant's address listed as 'Homeless'.*
